concise_definition: adj. 和解的, 调和的, 甘心接受的

definitions.explanation_en: Having restored a harmonious relationship after a conflict or disagreement; no longer hostile or estranged.
definitions.explanation_cn: 在发生冲突或分歧后，恢复了和谐关系；不再敌对或疏远。
definitions.example_en: After months of silence, the two brothers were finally reconciled.
definitions.example_cn: 经过数月的沉默，这两兄弟终于和解了。

definitions.explanation_en: Having come to accept or make peace with an unpleasant or difficult situation, often reluctantly.
definitions.explanation_cn: 已接受或与某种不愉快或困难的情况达成和解，常带有勉强的意味。
definitions.example_en: She was reconciled to the fact that she would never see her childhood home again.
definitions.example_cn: 她已接受再也无法回到童年家园的现实。

definitions.explanation_en: In accounting or finance, having been adjusted and verified to match between two sets of records, ensuring accuracy and consistency.
definitions.explanation_cn: 在会计或金融领域，指经过调整和核对，使两组记录一致，确保准确性和一致性。
definitions.example_en: The bank statement and the ledger were reconciled at the end of the month.
definitions.example_cn: 月末时，银行对账单与总账已核对一致。

comparison.analysis: “Forgiven” (被原谅的) 强调一方对另一方的过错给予宽恕，侧重情感上的释放，但不必然意味着关系的修复。而 “reconciled” 不仅包含原谅，更强调双方关系的重建与和谐恢复。
“Accepted” (接受的) 仅表示对某种现实的承认，可能带有被动或无奈，但不包含情感和解或关系修复的含义。而 “reconciled” 在用于人际关系或情境时，隐含了主动的调和与情感上的平复。
“Adjusted” (调整的) 通常用于物理、数值或系统层面的修正，如调整参数或时间。在会计语境中虽可与 “reconciled” 互换，但 “reconciled” 更强调核对后达成一致的最终状态，而 “adjusted” 仅指修改的过程。
